values.name: C#
values.desc: C# is one of our core languages at NICE.  We use it for a variety of applications, both web and non-web.  It is a modern, secure language with a mature development environment and good productivity tooling.

values.name: F#
values.desc: We've been trialling F# for some back-end api's and data transformation processes.  It feels familiar because its still .NET and enables a functional approach. We've enjoyed writing more concise code using it than typical C#, plus its type system is great for domain modelling.

values.name: NodeJS
values.desc: Serverside javascript. We are increasing using this for small websites and apps.  We like its lightweight nature and customisation potential.  It's enabling front end developers to be more involved in backend development and vice versa - boosting our development capacity.  It's got a thrivnig community with great development tools.  We are currently upskilling in this technology.

values.name: Meteor
values.desc: A full stack javascript framework.  It provides out of the box features like templating/binding/events/minification/testing by abstracting the implementation of these mechanisms from the developer.  The downside to this is you have restricted customisation abilities.  We've been trialling this for increased speed-to-market for a few CRUD-style single page applications.

values.name: SQL Server
values.desc: If you've got relational data, you need a relational database.  We use SQL Server and have done for a while.

values.name: Fast ESP
values.desc: This search technology is no longer supported by Microsoft and we are in the process of retiring it in favour of more modern and supported search technologies.

values.name: Elastic Search
values.desc: A highly optimised search technology providing high availability, full-text search, document oriented datastore.  Its got a great API
